review: I remember I used to love this game back in the day, but after playing one match it really shows how far it was fallen. If you want a decent hero shooter just play valorant, i haven't played it much, but at least its alive and has solid mechanics.

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

"Genshin Impact" is more better than the rubbsh "overwatch2". The worst game company I've ever seen.

To any Blizzard employees reading this, unless you're in the 20% that Blizzard lets work remote, they don't care about you.

-They massively cut profit sharing and belittled employee concerns about it.
-They fired Brian Birmingham for standing up for his team against a terrible "stack ranking" policy.
-QA is paid less than similar positions at other companies.
-Bobby Kotick is still there despite using Fran's email address to send an email belittling very valid sexism complaints-- almost literally using a woman as a prop to beat other women down.

I know finding a new job is scary, but you owe it to yourself to try.
